name: Evgenia Smirni
content: Evgenia Smirni's Home Page Evgenia Smirni Sidney P. Chockley Professor College of William and Mary Computer Science Department Mailing address College of William and Mary Department of Computer Science P.O. Box 8795 Williamsburg, VA 23187-8795 Office McGlothlin-Street Hall, 103 Phone: +1-757-221-3580 Fax: +1-757-221-1717 Main Office: +1-757-221-3455 Full CV [ PDF ] For electronic contact info: please refer to the CV Research Interests Performance, Reliability and Dependability, Applied Machine Learning, Analytical Modeling, Workload Characterization, Markov Chains, Matrix-Analytic Methods, Performance Tools, HPC, Data Centers, Storage Systems, Cloud Computing IEEE Fellow, ACM Distinguished Scientist, IFIP W.G.s 7.3 and 10.4 SIGMETRICS 2023 General Chair List of Publications (from the DBLP Bibliography Server) (for a full list take a look at the CV and email me if there is a paper that you cannot access) What I have been working on recently... [VLDB'22] "Optimizing Inference Serving on Serverless Platforms" [GoodIT'22] "GeoSpread: an Epidemic Spread Modeling Tool for COVID-19 Using Mobility Data" [DSN'22] "	Strategic Safety-Critical Attacks against an Advanced Driver Assistance System" [IEEE TDSC'22] "Lifespan and Failures of SSDs and HDDs: Similarities, Differences, and Prediction Models", (to appear). [DSN'21] "Data-centric Reliability Management in GPUs" [Sigmetrics'21] ``SUGAR: Speeding-up GPGPU Application Resilience Estimation with Input Sizing". [ICSE 2021] "Enabling Software Resilience in GPGPU Applications via Partial Thread Protection". [IEEE TC'21] "Practical Resilience Analysis of GPGPU Applications in the Presence of Single- and Multi-Bit Faults". [SC'20] "BATCH: Machine Learning Inference Serving on Serverless Platforms with Adaptive Batching". [DSN'20] "Mining Multivariate Discrete Event Sequences for Knowledge Discovery and Anomaly Detection". Software: KPC ToolBox , MAMSolver Tool Service to the Community/Professional Activities Keynote DSN 2023: The 53rd Annual IEEE/IFIP International Conference on Dependable Systems and Networks Associate Editor IEEE Transactions on Computers 2023 - Associate Editor IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems 2023 - Program committee track chair (Cloud Computing and Data Centers) ICDCS 2021, 41st IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems Keynote 17th International Conference on Quantitative Evaluation of SysTems (QEST 2020), (part of the QONFEST multi-conference). Keynote 10th ACM/SPEC International Conference on Performance Engineering Mumbai, India, April 7-11, 2019 Associate Editor IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing 2019 - 2023 Program committee co-chair HPDC 2019, The 28th ACM International Symposium on High-Performance Parallel and Distributed Computing Program committee co-chair SRDS 2019, The 38th IEEE International Symposium on Reliable Distributed Systems Program committee co-chair DSN 2017, The 47th Annual IEEE/IFIP International Conference on Dependable Systems and Networks Program committee co-chair ICPE 2017, The 8th ACM/SPEC International Conference on Performance Engineering General co-chair QEST'10 and Numerical Solutions of Markov Chains 2010 Program committee co-chair HotMetrics 2010 Program committee co-chair SIGMETRICS/Performance'06 Program committee co-chair QEST'05 Editor Performance Evaluation Review 2003-2009 Associate Editor ACM Transactions on Modeling and Performance Evaluation of Computing Systems 2015 - Collaborators, Past and Present Students Riccardo Pinciroli, Postdoctoral Research Associate, 2018-2020, now at Gran Sasso Research Institute, L'Aquila, Italy. Lishan Yang , Ph.D., graduate 2022, Assistant Professor at George Mason Anna Schmedding, Ph.D. student, in progress Bowen Sun, Ph.D. student, in progress Yiyang Lu, Ph.D. student, in progress Bin Nie , Ph.D., graduated May 2019, Google Jacob Alter, M.S., graduated May 2019 Ji Xue , Ph.D. graduated May 2017, Google Feng Yan , Ph.D. graduated May 2016, Associate Professor at University of Houston. Jiawei Wen, M.S., graduated 2016. Lihua Ren, M.S., graduated 2016. Lei Lu , Ph.D. graduated December 2014, VMWare, Palo Alto, CA. Shannon Hughes, M.S. student, graduated May 2013, Xenia Mountrouidou , Postdoctoral Research Associate 2009-2011, Assistant Prof. at Jacksonville State University Giuliano Casale, Postdoctoral Research Associate 2007--2008, now Associate Professor at Imperial College London. Ningfang Mi, Ph.D. graduated May 2009, Associate Professor, Northeastern University. Qi Zhang, Ph.D., graduated December 2006, Microsoft Redmont. Zhili Hua, M.S., graduated 2005 Ling Liu, M.S., graduated 2004 Alma Riska ,Ph.D., graduated November 2002, first placement at Seagate Research, now at Meta. Vesselin Diev, M.S., graduated 2002 Daniela Puiu, M.S., graduated 2002 Melissa Rau, M.S., graduated 1999, NASA Langley
